content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica is trying on a pair of new boots as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! So what do you think?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: New haircut? (Monica nods ‘No.’) Necklace? (No) Dress? (No) Boots? (Monica nods ‘Yes.’) Boots!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes! Now, they’re a little more than I normally spend on boots…or rent (Shows him the receipt.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m gonna miss being able to afford food.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry, they just, they just look so good! And the saleswoman was looking at me like, “Oh, these are way too expensive for you.”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She had a point. (Shows her the receipt.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! (Notices the boots) Oh Monica! Those boots are amazing!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They’re mine!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah well, too bad we’re gonna have to return them.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Return them?! Shh! They’re gonna hear you!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, I’m not returning them. Okay? I mean I-I know they cost a lot, but I’m going to wear them all the time. You’ll see. Besides, I love the compliments. I mean, have you ever had something so beautiful everyone wanted it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I have you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nice try; I’m keeping the boots.

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe, Ross, and Rachel are sitting on the couch and Ross is talking to Rachel’s, who is now showing, stomach.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s right, I love you! And-and I’m gonna play with you all the time.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How can you let him talk to your crotch like that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: He’s talking to the baby.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh! Okay! Okay, cause when-when he said, “I can’t wait to hear your first words,” I thought, “There’s a trick.”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Well, I gotta go you guys. I’ll see you later.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Bye. (She gets up to leave but is stopped by Joey)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh hey Rach, listen—Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Umm, can you do me a favor? I was talkin’ to my sister and she knows you work at Ralph Lauren …

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, forget it! No way! I am not sending anymore Ralph Lauren clothes to prison. It is a waste.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no-no-no-no-no, not her, not her. My youngest sister, Dina, she’s really interested in fashion, and she wants to talk to someone successful, y’know, to give her some advice.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I guess I can talk to one of my supervisors…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh no-no-no-no, she wants to talk to you!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?! Oh my God! I’m successful!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, so will you meet with her?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes! I’d love to! Have her come by the office.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Great! Thanks! You’re gonna love her so much. And—Oh, she’s the smartest of all the Tribbiani children. Hey, y’know the S.A.T’s?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She took ‘em!
(Joey goes to get coffee and Rachel exits as the camera pans to Phoebe and Ross on the couch.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey Ross! Doesn’t Ben go to the Smithfield Day School?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. Why?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sting has a son that goes there too!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah I know; he’s in Ben’s class.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You knew this and you never said anything?! With all the stupid dinosaur stuff you tell us?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine! No more dinosaur stuff! Can I talk about fossils? (Joey is about to sit down and hears this so instead he groans and exits.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sting’s son, seven years old and there’s a picture.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What are you reading? The Kidnappers Guide to Manhattan Private Schools?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, it’s New York magazine. It’s an article about the best schools in the city. So how well do you know Sting?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, I actually haven’t even met him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh, yeah that’s too bad. I really want to go to his concert Friday night, but it’s totally sold out. I know! Why don’t you meet him and get tickets?! If you get two I’ll take you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well actually, I’m picking Ben up tomorrow, maybe he’ll be there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: There you go! Oh, you are so lucky! You might actually get to meet Sting tomorrow! That’s why you have kids!

content.description: Central Perk, the next day Rachel, Phoebe, and Chandler are there as Monica enters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey guys!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey-hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi Monica!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey. (Sits down on the arm of the couch.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi boots.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: See Chandler? I’m getting a lot of use out of them already! They’re very practical. See, you can wear them with dresses, with skirts, with pants…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You can wear them with shorts on a street corner and earn the money to pay for them. (Goes and gets some coffee at the counter.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! They’re beautiful!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ahh…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They hurt so much!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The guy who made these hates feet and wants to see them die!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well-well you can give them to me! I haven’t felt my feet in years!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t! I spent so much money on them and I told Chandler that I’d wear them all the time, I just can’t give them away!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well then get your money back and return them!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t do that either! The soles’ are already a little scuffed up and the insides are filled with my blood.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey I uh just picked up Ben from school…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t think you did a very thorough job!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I dropped him off at Carol’s. (To Phoebe) Anyway, it turns out that I’m not going to be able to get those tickets though.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no! Why not?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well it turns out that Ben and Sting’s son do not get along.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How come?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Apparently, Sting’s son made fun of the fact that Ben’s moms are lesbinims.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait! But Ross if they don’t get along then you should smooth things over. Make them be friends.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe, you can’t force kids to be friends.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sure you can! Give them some blocks, put them in a playpen!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Playpen?! Ben’s seven!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Your kid is seven?! (Ross nods, “Yes.”) (To the rest) He’s really small. (To Ross) Please! Please get the tickets!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look I’m sorry Pheebs, I can’t do it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes you can! Sting says so himself!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rosssss can !

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look Phoebe, I’m sorry it’s just…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rossss can !

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe, I…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rosss can! Give me the tickets! Ross can give me the tickets !!
(Ross runs out to get the tickets.)

content.description: Rachel’s Office, Joey has brought Dina to meet with Rachel.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Here she is! Future fashion superstar!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Joey, I’m hardly a…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: My little sister Dina!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right! Hi Dina!

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nice to meet you. (They shake hands.)

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: Thanks so much for meetin’ with me. Joey’s told me so much about you!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This is so exciting for her. Well, I’ll let you two fash…ists get down to business. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. All right Dina, well let’s talk about the different areas of fashion that you could get involved in. Let’s see, there’s design, but you may need a whole other degree for that. Uh, there’s-there’s sales, which is great because you get to travel…

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: I…I don’t care about fashion! I’m pregnant! And I know you are too, so you gotta help me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And there’s marketing…

content.description: The Hallway, Monica is returning, but before she enters the apartment she stops on the step and changes from wearing tennis shoes to the boots and she moans in pain as she puts each boot on.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ahhhhhhhh!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s wrong?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh nothing I’m just—just was yawning. (Mimics the groan from before and stretches.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh don’t forget, my office holiday party is tonight. (They go into the apartment.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, we don’t really have to go to this thing tonight do we?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Now sweetie, I know you don’t like my office parties, but you can wear your new boots. See? Every cloud has a…supple leather lining.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I-I don’t-I don’t think that I’m gonna wear the boots tonight.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well y’know, I’m just-I’m just worried that bosses will see them and think they pay you too much money. Or! Or your assistant will see them and-and want a raise!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do you think I work at some kind of boot pricing company?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Anyway, I picked up this outfit that I want to wear and the, and the boots don’t really go with it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You said that you paid all that money because those boots go with skirts, dresses, and pants!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Fine! If you want me to wear the boots, I’ll wear the boots. In fact, I’ll go into my room right now and y’know try the outfit on.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay? (She starts to walk which causes her to start crying) Ooo wee! Christmas party in my boots! (Runs into the bedroom and mixes saying ‘ow’ with laughing.)

content.description: The Hallway, Rachel is about to enter her apartment with Dina to tell Joey the news.

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: I-I can’t go in there. I can’t tell him!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, it’s going to be okay. He’s been incredibly supportive of me, and if he gets a little upset; that’s what the meatball sub is for. (She gives Dina a sandwich wrapped in aluminum foil.)

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.
(They enter.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! It’s my fashion girls! (They don’t react.) What’s wrong?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, why don’t you sit down? Dina has something that she wants to tell you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh. What’s, what’s going on? Is it mom? Is she sick? Is it dad’s heart? Is that a sandwich?

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: Joe, mom and dad are fine…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Is that a sandwich?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey…there’s something that you…should know. Dina?

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: I’m pregnant.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Now! Give him the sandwich! Give him the sandwich! (She quickly sets the sandwich in front of him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well obviously this is a mistake! You can’t be pregnant! Because you have to have sex to get pregnant!

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: Joe, I tried to wait until I was 25 like you did!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! Dina…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Bub!!! (Points at her and quiets Rachel.) (To Dina) I can’t believe this! You’re the good one! You went to college! Both years! Who did this to you?!

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: Bobby Corso, but he’s a real nice guy. I like him a lot. He’s real funny.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You got pregnant for funny?! Dina…if he’s funny… laugh ! All right, I’ll be back in a little while! You stay here!

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: Why? Where are you going?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t look at you right now! (Exits and slams the door behind him.)

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: Wow.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know.
(Joey storms back in and covering his face so he doesn’t see Dina grabs the sandwich and heads back out.)

content.description: The Midfield Day School, it’s after school and Ben is taking a drink of water as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, there you are Ben!

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Aunt Phoebe, what are you doing here?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I heard you’re having a problem with one of the boys in your class. And so I thought I would just come down here and sit you both down, have a little talk and make it all okay. Now umm, the boy’s name is Sting’s son.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Jack? I hate him! He’s a jerk.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Now Ben, sometimes people may seem like jerks on the outside, but they have famous fathers.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: I have to go. My friend Doug is waiting for me over there. (Goes over to Doug.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Him you’re friends with. (Starts looking at the children trying to find Jack and a teacher notices her.)

content.speaker: The Teacher
content.text: Excuse me. Can, can I help you with something?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes! Yes you can, I’m looking for Jack’s parents.

content.speaker: The Teacher
content.text: Are you with one of the students?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh, I’m with Ben.

content.speaker: The Teacher
content.text: Are you one of Ben’s mothers?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I am one of Ben’s mothers. I’m a lesbian. It was, it was difficult coming out to my parents.

content.speaker: The Teacher
content.text: Well hi, I’m Jenny Boone. I’m the new teacher here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: The Teacher
content.text: I’ve only met your partner Carol.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ah! Okay so that would make me Susan.

content.speaker: The Teacher
content.text: Right. Are you looking for Jack’s parents to discuss the problems he’s having with Ben? (Phoebe nods ‘Yes.’) Yeah. Because I really do think the parents should sit down and have a conversation.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! Let’s do that!! That-that sounds good. We should sit down and talk, just me, my lover Carol, and the Stings. Umm, how-how will I get in touch with them?

content.speaker: The Teacher
content.text: Oh, their number is on the contact sheet.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh. Uh-huh. Umm, could-could I get a copy of that? ‘Cause Carol threw it out, she lost ours. She’s such a scatterbrain, but man what a hot piece of ass.

content.description: A Street, Chandler and Monica are walking down the sidewalk after his office holiday party.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, that party wasn’t bad.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah! I didn’t know there would be dancing. That was a fun surprise!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t see any uh, cabs. Maybe we should just walk?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no, we can’t walk!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What honey, it’s like fifteen blocks to the subway. Let’s go.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! Do you think that we can get to the subway right there if we climb down through the manhole cover?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s going on?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t walk. Okay? Okay? These boots were a huge mistake!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay you were right! All right, I never should have bought them! They’re killing me! One toe at a time!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So I was right. This is what it feels like to be right. (Pause) It’s oddly unsettling.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How are we gonna get home? Maybe a piggy-back ride?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hop on.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. Wait, just give me a second, I need to just get my boots off first. (She starts taking them off.) Ah…Ooh…Oohh…Ohh…Oh God…Ohh…Oh…Ohh…Ohhhh…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Honey, I know you’re in pain right now, but I’m a little turned on.

content.description: [Scene: Joey and Rachel’s, Dina and Rachel are reading pregnancy books, Dina Pregnancy for Dummies and Rachel something else.]

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: Do you ever worry that you’ll be walking and your baby will just like slip out?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What college was that Dina?
(Joey enters dragging a guy.)

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: Oh my God! Bobby!

content.speaker: Bobby
content.text: Hi Dina. Good to see you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, what are you doing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Just what needs to be done! Dearly beloved, we are gathered here to join this man and this woman…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Joey this is crazy!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Don’t interrupt me when I’m talkin’ to God! Now where were we? Oh right, okay. Do you Dina, take this man…

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh you’ll take ‘em!

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: No I won’t!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! You don’t get a say in this!

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: Yes I do!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahhh! I heard “I do”, we’re halfway there! Okay! (To Bobby) You!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right Joey! That is enough! (Grabs him and pulls him away from Bobby and Dina) Listen, as beautiful and moving as this ceremony is, it’s not legal. Okay? They-they don’t have a marriage license, they don’t have any witnesses, and the groom only has on one shoe!

content.speaker: Bobby
content.text: Yeah, he took the other one off and hit me with it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well what am I supposed to do?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re supposed to realize that they are adults! And that they can make their own decisions.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No they can’t! They were stupid enough to get knocked up!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Heyyyyy! Contraceptives are not always effective! (To Bobby and Dina) Right?

content.speaker: Bobby
content.text: Yeah…we kinda didn’t use any…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, come on kids! A little help here!

content.description: Sting’s Apartment, Phoebe has come to talk about Jack and is waiting for Sting’s wife, Trudie Styler, to enter.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! This place is incredible! (Gasps) Sting’s pen…that he gave to Phoebe. (Puts the pen in her purse and goes over to a floor-to-ceiling bookcase) Come on! Secret passageway! (Starts pulling books at random as Trudie enters.)

content.speaker: Trudie Styler
content.text: Hi! (By the way, it’s actually her.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Trudie Styler
content.text: I’m Trudie.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Trudie Styler
content.text: You must be Ben’s mum.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why else would I be here?

content.speaker: Trudie Styler
content.text: Do sit down.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh. (They go and sit down.)

content.speaker: Trudie Styler
content.text: I gather Jack and Ben haven’t been getting along lately.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Trudie Styler
content.text: I’m told there are two sides to this story, but all I’ve heard is that Ben’s a bit of a poo-poo head.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, I’m sorry. Won’t-won’t Jack’s father be joining us?

content.speaker: Trudie Styler
content.text: Oh I’m sorry, Jack’s father is not available.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-hmm. Okay. Well then, could we reschedule? For say, Friday night perhaps at 8 o’clock?

content.speaker: Trudie Styler
content.text: Oh no, I know that wouldn’t work. My husband’s in concert.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Concert. Yeah. That does put us in…quite a pickle. Because you see I’m very busy before and after the concert, and he’s obviously busy during.

content.speaker: Trudie Styler
content.text: So, I guess you and I should talk about Jack and Ben right now.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Unless! Unless umm, okay I-I would be willing to go to the concert, umm, all the while thinking about the children of course.

content.speaker: Trudie Styler
content.text: Are you here for tickets?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, thank you. Four would be great.

content.speaker: Trudie Styler
content.text: I’m not giving concert tickets to someone who’d use their son like this!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh good! Then you’re in luck! Ben’s not my son!

content.speaker: Trudie Styler
content.text: Look, I’ve just pressed a button, triggering a silent alarm. Any minute now, the police will be here!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: The Police? Here? A reunion?! (She gets out her camera.)

content.description: The Street, Chandler is carrying Monica past a store window.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, ten blocks down. Five to go.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh wait! Stop! Stop! Stop!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh I’m sorry! Do you need a break?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: My boots in tan! Hey! Can you get a little closer so I can see the price?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can see it from right here. It’ll cost you one husband.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I’m sorry. I think I can walk the rest of the way now. Just-just give me my boots.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t have your boots.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well I don’t have them either. Where are they?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, why don’t you check in one of my saddlebags while I chew on a bale of hay!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (She gets off him.) God well, we gotta go back and get them!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Honey, are you seriously ever gonna wear the boots again?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I’m never gonna wear them again. I just didn’t get a chance to say goodbye.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what? You can say goodbye to the tan ones.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (Climbs back on his back.) All right.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (Moves closer to the window.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bye boots—Wait! Half off?! (Chandler runs off.)

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey and Rachel are still discussing Bobby and Dina’s situation.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, just because they’re not getting married doesn’t mean this is going to be a disaster. Maybe they have a plan!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh? Oh! Okay! Okay! Let’s hear their plan! Now, what’s the future look like for Dina and Bobby?

content.speaker: Bobby
content.text: Well…I really have high hopes for my band.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You were right. He is funny.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, now wait a minute! I get when you told people at first that you wanted to be an actor they laughed at you! Now come on Bobby, why don’t you tell us a little bit about your band?

content.speaker: Bobby
content.text: Well it’s just me and my pal Rooster, the band’s name is Numb Nuts.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really? (Nods her head at Bobby.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dina, if you’re having a baby you should be married! Even if it is to Bobby! (Bobby gets happy.) Dude, that’s not a compliment!

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: No Joey! I knew you wouldn’t be supportive!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! What are you gonna do? You’re gonna have the baby and-and raise it by yourself…without a husband?! You can’t be a single mother alone! You’re gonna ruin your life!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh excuse me! Am I ruining my life?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! No! No! It’s different for you. You’re so strong and together. You’re not some dumb kid who doesn’t know what she’s doing.

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: Excuse me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: One pregnant woman at a time, please! I just want you to be okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So forcing her to marry Bobby is gonna make that happen?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe! (To Bobby) Well! Well…so-so uh, what kind of music does Numb Nuts—Oh forget it! I can’t!

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: Joey, I am scared to death about this. But I really think I can do it, I’m just gonna need some help. And Bobby’s gonna be here the whole time.

content.speaker: Bobby
content.text: You bet I am! (To Joey) And to answer your earlier question, we’re straight-up gangster rap. (Joey shakes his head as if he’s about to lose it.)

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: Look, Rachel’s told me how much easier you’ve made all this on her. Why can’t you do that for me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Because! ‘Cause… ‘Cause you’re my baby sister!

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: And you’re my big brother! I mean, you’re my favorite guy in the whole world. I’m not even scared to tell mom and dad. I was scared of telling you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well I’d be scared of them, but all right.

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: Joey, I can’t stand the thought of having this baby with you mad at me. I want him to have his uncle. Is my baby gonna have his Uncle Joey?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Of course he’s gonna have his Uncle Joey!

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: We’re gonna be all right. I mean, even if we’re not married this baby is gonna be so loved. Not just by us.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s right! By his uncle too!

content.speaker: Bobby
content.text: And by you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay Bobby, why don’t we just come over here and let them have a little moment. (Drags Bobby away from Joey and Dina.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come here! (Hugs Dina and Bobby looks to hug Rachel.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Seriously! What’s wrong with you?!

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe and Ross are there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re gonna love me so much. I got Sting tickets!! (Holds up two.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! I do love you! How did you do it?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well…let’s just say… (singing) Rosss caaaaan !

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oo, where are the seats?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, middle balcony.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, now would you say that that’s more than 50 yards away from Sting, his wife, or a member of his family?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Then that’s not breaking the law! I’m there!
